children.subject: Also wondering what other CS upper divs I could possibly get in if I register during the adjustment period. Thank you

history.content: there's no harm in trying to enroll so you might as well just sign up and see if you get in. same goes for other classes.

To clarify, major standing provides absolutely no priority for enrollment unless students sign up in phase 1 or phase 2.  

If you sign up before the end of phase 2 -- that is, if you demonstrate that it is important to you and use some of your limited units to do so -- then you are prioritized over non-majors. Non-majors who sign up in phase 2 are higher on both the literal and effective waitlist than declared majors who wait until adjustment period. (Note -- the new enrollment system's inability to allow students to switch secondary sections while on the waitlist without dropping puts a wrinkle here that we honestly have not figured out how to accommodate.)

See https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

Is there any chance for me to be able to enroll in the class if I waitlist it during adjustment period? The class has a total of 481 seats, right now 325 are enrolled and 250 are on the waitlist (so about 156 open seats left). I will be declared in January so I will be pushed to the front of the waitlist. But I am wondering if it is a good idea to do so. Thank you.
history.subject: CS 186 Adjustment Period Enrollment
